Detailed Description

MessageHook is the base class to implement a hook to any message in the system.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum MessageHook::Mode
 

Defines in which context MessageHook::OnMessage is called.

Enumerator:
Asynchronous  OnMessage method is called in context of the MessageHook's owner.
Synchronous  OnMessage is called directly in an undefined execution context.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN MessageHook::Attach (  MsgId  message_id,
Mode  mode = Asynchronous
)  [virtual]
 

Attaches this MessageHook instance to the global list of MessageHooks.

Parameters:
message_id message identifier of the message to be hooked.
mode defines, in which context the method OnMessage is called.
Returns:
false, if attach fails of any reason (like already attached, memory allocation fails).

void MessageHook::Detach (   )  [virtual]
 

Removes this instance of the MessageHook from the global message hook list.

ExecutionContext* MessageHook::GetExecutionContext (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the execution context of an asynchronous message hook. In case of a synchronous message hook there is no need to run in a defined execution context and the return value is zero. Also the return value is zero if the message hook is not attached.

virtual BOOLEAN MessageHook::OnMessage (  Message &  message  )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

If a message gets hooked, by a corresponding message hook OnMessage is called. The inherited class decides by the return code of it's OnMessage implementation, if the hooked message should be sent or not. It is possible to modify the original message and also to discard the message, so that no registered recipient will ever get the message delivered. ATTENTION: There are two strong restriction to the implementation of OnMessage, if the MessageHook is used in Synchronous mode. First, it is NOT ALLOWED to implement any time-consuming, blocking or conditional waiting code (like the active wait construct) within this method. Also be aware of unobvious active waits called by any other class/method. And second, be aware that the you are NOT in any defined ExecutionContext (e.g. Application). This means any call (e.g. System::GetActiveApplication(), any ASC handler access, any ADC Provider access, ...) refering to such a context is also NOT ALLOWED. Just manipulation on the inherited MessageHook itself, the message parameter or any global object are VALID! So please handle this powerful construct with extreme care, otherwise you may break the whole system stability!!!

Parameters:
message original hooked message, which can also be modified
Returns:
return TRUE, if the hooked message should be released and dispatched to the official registered recipients.
